issues.description: Missing illustration complexity tiers - no clear rules for detail levels

suggestedFixes.fix: Implement 16px base grid with 2px stroke at 24px, scaling to 32/48/64px sizes
suggestedFixes.rationale: Standard sizing ensures consistent visual weight across all applications

suggestedFixes.fix: Create 3 tiers: Simple (5 elements), Standard (8 elements), Hero (12 elements max)
suggestedFixes.rationale: Defined complexity prevents cognitive overload for busy owners

suggestedFixes.fix: Use glass morphism, dotted connections, and open frames to show transparency
suggestedFixes.rationale: Visual transparency literally demonstrates brand promise

suggestedFixes.fix: Apply 60-30-10 rule: primary visual, supporting element, accent detail
suggestedFixes.rationale: Clear hierarchy guides eye movement in predictable patterns

suggestedFixes.fix: Develop 5 core patterns: grid dots, connection lines, growth curves, stability blocks, flow arrows
suggestedFixes.rationale: Repeatable motifs create subconscious brand recognition

suggestedFixes.fix: Use 80% literal representations, 20% abstract for complex concepts only
suggestedFixes.rationale: Literal icons reduce cognitive load for time-pressed owners

suggestedFixes.fix: Limit to brand primary + 2 supporting colors per illustration, 70-20-10 ratio
suggestedFixes.rationale: Controlled palette maintains calm, professional atmosphere

suggestedFixes.fix: Standardize 2px stroke for all icons, with 1.5px for sub-16px sizes
suggestedFixes.rationale: Consistent stroke weight creates cohesive icon family

suggestedFixes.fix: Show dashboard overview with clear data visualization as primary hero metaphor
suggestedFixes.rationale: Dashboard visual instantly communicates control and clarity

suggestedFixes.fix: Create simplified geometric versions of all complex illustrations
suggestedFixes.rationale: Fallbacks ensure message clarity when detail overwhelms
